snippet: The governor of New Jersey called for a special election to fill Frank Lautenberg’s Senate seat because it might give him a political advantage. But it will cost state taxpayers.
abstract: Editorial criticizes New Jersey Gov Chris Christie for calling special election for Senate seat left vacant by death of Sen Frank Lautenberg; contends choice imposes unnecessary cost on state taxpayers for marginal political advantage for Christie's re-election chances.
lead_paragraph: The governor of New Jersey called for a special election to fill Frank Lautenberg’s Senate seat because it might give him a political advantage. But it will cost state taxpayers.

headline.seo: Gov. Christie’s Quick, Costly Decision on Lautenberg’s Seat
